articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: A jury orders Tesla to pay more than $240 million in Autopilot crash - NPR
articles.description: A Miami jury decided Tesla was partly responsible for a deadly 2019 crash in Florida involving its Autopilot driver assist technology. The automaker said it will appeal.
articles.content: MIAMI A Miami jury decided that Elon Musk's car company Tesla was partly responsible for a deadly crash in Florida involving its Autopilot driver assist technology and must pay the victims more than … [+5622 chars]

articles.author: Beth Mole
articles.title: Under RFK Jr, CDC skips study on vaccination rates, quietly posts data on drop - Ars Technica
articles.description: Vaccination rates fell once again as nonmedical exemptions hit a new high.
